   34  S 236.00 DEFINITIONS.
   35    1. "ANIMAL," AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE, INCLUDES EVERY  LIVING  CREATURE
   36  EXCEPT A HUMAN BEING.
   37    2.  "TORTURE"  OR  "CRUELTY" INCLUDES EVERY ACT, OMISSION, OR NEGLECT,
   38  WHEREBY UNJUSTIFIABLE PHYSICAL PAIN, SUFFERING OR  DEATH  IS  CAUSED  OR
   39  PERMITTED.
   40    3.  "ADOPTION" MEANS THE DELIVERY TO ANY NATURAL PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS
   41  OF AGE OR OLDER, FOR THE LIMITED PURPOSE OF HARBORING A PET, OF ANY  DOG
   42  OR CAT, SEIZED OR SURRENDERED.
   43    4.  "FARM  ANIMAL", AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE, MEANS ANY UNGULATE, POUL-
   44  TRY, SPECIES OF CATTLE, SHEEP, SWINE, GOATS, LLAMAS, HORSES OR FUR-BEAR-
   45  ING ANIMALS, AS DEFINED IN SECTION 11-1907 OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL  CONSER-
   46  VATION  LAW,  WHICH  ARE  RAISED FOR COMMERCIAL OR SUBSISTENCE PURPOSES.
   47  FUR-BEARING ANIMAL SHALL NOT INCLUDE DOGS OR CATS.
   48    5. "COMPANION ANIMAL" OR "PET" MEANS ANY DOG OR CAT,  AND  SHALL  ALSO
   49  MEAN  ANY  OTHER  DOMESTICATED ANIMAL NORMALLY MAINTAINED IN OR NEAR THE
   50  HOUSEHOLD OF THE OWNER OR PERSON WHO CARES FOR SUCH  OTHER  DOMESTICATED
   51  ANIMAL. "PET" OR "COMPANION ANIMAL" SHALL NOT INCLUDE A "FARM ANIMAL" AS
   52  DEFINED IN THIS SECTION.
   53  S 236.01 PROHIBITION OF ANIMAL FIGHTING.
   54    1. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "ANIMAL FIGHTING" SHALL MEAN
   55  ANY FIGHT BETWEEN COCKS OR OTHER BIRDS, OR BETWEEN DOGS, BULLS, BEARS OR

       A. 1835                             3

    1  ANY  OTHER  ANIMALS, OR BETWEEN ANY SUCH ANIMAL AND A PERSON OR PERSONS,
    2  EXCEPT IN EXHIBITIONS OF A KIND COMMONLY FEATURED AT RODEOS.
    3    2. ANY PERSON WHO ENGAGES IN ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CONDUCT IS GUILTY OF
    4  A  FELONY  PUNISHABLE  BY  IMPRISONMENT  FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED FOUR
    5  YEARS, OR BY A FINE NOT TO EXCEED TWENTY-FIVE THOUSAND  DOLLARS,  OR  BY
    6  BOTH SUCH FINE AND IMPRISONMENT:
    7    (A)  FOR  AMUSEMENT  OR  GAIN,  CAUSES  ANY ANIMAL TO ENGAGE IN ANIMAL
    8  FIGHTING; OR
    9    (B) TRAINS ANY ANIMAL UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES EVINCING AN INTENT THAT SUCH
   10  ANIMAL ENGAGE IN ANIMAL FIGHTING FOR AMUSEMENT OR GAIN; OR
   11    (C) BREEDS, SELLS OR OFFERS FOR SALE ANY  ANIMAL  UNDER  CIRCUMSTANCES
   12  EVINCING AN INTENT THAT SUCH ANIMAL ENGAGE IN ANIMAL FIGHTING; OR
   13    (D)  PERMITS  ANY  ACT  DESCRIBED IN PARAGRAPH (A), (B) OR (C) OF THIS
   14  SUBDIVISION TO OCCUR ON PREMISES UNDER HIS CONTROL; OR
   15    (E) OWNS, POSSESSES OR KEEPS ANY ANIMAL TRAINED TO  ENGAGE  IN  ANIMAL
   16  FIGHTING  ON  PREMISES  WHERE  AN EXHIBITION OF ANIMAL FIGHTING IS BEING
   17  CONDUCTED UNDER CIRCUMSTANCES EVINCING AN INTENT THAT SUCH ANIMAL ENGAGE
   18  IN ANIMAL FIGHTING.
   19    3. (A) ANY PERSON WHO ENGAGES IN CONDUCT SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF
   20  THIS SUBDIVISION IS GUILTY OF A MISDEMEANOR AND IS PUNISHABLE BY  IMPRI-
   21  SONMENT  FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED ONE YEAR, OR BY A FINE NOT TO EXCEED
   22  FIFTEEN THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH SUCH FINE AND IMPRISONMENT.
   23    (B) THE OWNING, POSSESSING OR KEEPING  OF  ANY  ANIMAL  UNDER  CIRCUM-
   24  STANCES EVINCING AN INTENT THAT SUCH ANIMAL ENGAGE IN ANIMAL FIGHTING.
   25    4. (A) ANY PERSON WHO ENGAGES IN CONDUCT SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF
   26  THIS  SUBDIVISION IS GUILTY OF A MISDEMEANOR AND IS PUNISHABLE BY IMPRI-
   27  SONMENT FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED ONE YEAR, OR BY A FINE NOT TO  EXCEED
   28  ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH SUCH FINE AND IMPRISONMENT.
   29    (B)  THE  KNOWING PRESENCE AS A SPECTATOR HAVING PAID AN ADMISSION FEE
   30  OR HAVING MADE A WAGER AT ANY PLACE WHERE AN EXHIBITION OF ANIMAL FIGHT-
   31  ING IS BEING CONDUCTED.
   32    5. (A) ANY PERSON WHO ENGAGES IN THE CONDUCT  SPECIFIED  IN  PARAGRAPH
   33  (B)  OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION IS GUILTY OF A VIOLATION PUNISHABLE BY A FINE
   34  NOT TO EXCEED FIVE HUNDRED  DOLLARS.  ANY  PERSON  WHO  ENGAGES  IN  THE
   35  CONDUCT SPECIFIED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF THIS SUBDIVISION AFTER HAVING BEEN
   36  CONVICTED WITHIN THE PREVIOUS FIVE YEARS OF A VIOLATION OF THIS SUBDIVI-
   37  SION  OR SUBDIVISION FOUR OF THIS SECTION IS GUILTY OF A MISDEMEANOR AND
   38  IS PUNISHABLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED ONE YEAR, OR BY
   39  A FINE NOT TO EXCEED ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH BY SUCH  FINE  AND
   40  IMPRISONMENT.
   41    (B)  THE KNOWING PRESENCE AS A SPECTATOR AT ANY PLACE WHERE AN EXHIBI-
   42  TION OF ANIMAL FIGHTING IS BEING CONDUCTED.
   43  S 236.02 OVERDRIVING, TORTURING AND INJURING ANIMALS; FAILURE TO PROVIDE
   44             PROPER SUSTENANCE.
   45    A PERSON WHO OVERDRIVES,  OVERLOADS,  TORTURES  OR  CRUELLY  BEATS  OR
   46  UNJUSTIFIABLY  INJURES,  MAIMS,  MUTILATES  OR KILLS ANY ANIMAL, WHETHER
   47  WILD OR TAME, AND  WHETHER  BELONGING  TO  HIMSELF  OR  TO  ANOTHER,  OR
   48  DEPRIVES  ANY ANIMAL OF NECESSARY SUSTENANCE, FOOD OR DRINK, OR NEGLECTS
   49  OR REFUSES TO FURNISH IT SUCH SUSTENANCE OR DRINK, OR  CAUSES,  PROCURES
   50  OR  PERMITS  ANY  ANIMAL TO BE OVERDRIVEN, OVERLOADED, TORTURED, CRUELLY
   51  BEATEN, OR UNJUSTIFIABLY INJURED, MAIMED, MUTILATED OR KILLED, OR TO  BE
   52  DEPRIVED  OF  NECESSARY  FOOD  OR  DRINK,  OR WHO WILFULLY SETS ON FOOT,
   53  INSTIGATES, ENGAGES IN, OR IN ANY WAY FURTHERS ANY ACT OF CRUELTY TO ANY
   54  ANIMAL, OR ANY ACT TENDING TO PRODUCE SUCH CRUELTY, IS GUILTY OF A CLASS
   55  A MISDEMEANOR AND FOR PURPOSES OF PARAGRAPH (B) OF  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF

       A. 1835                             4

    1  SECTION  160.10  OF  THE  CRIMINAL  PROCEDURE LAW, SHALL BE TREATED AS A
    2  MISDEMEANOR DEFINED IN THE PENAL LAW.
    3    NOTHING  IN  THIS  SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO PROHIBIT OR INTERFERE
    4  WITH ANY PROPERLY CONDUCTED SCIENTIFIC TESTS,  EXPERIMENTS  OR  INVESTI-
    5  GATIONS,  INVOLVING THE USE OF LIVING ANIMALS, PERFORMED OR CONDUCTED IN
    6  LABORATORIES OR INSTITUTIONS, WHICH ARE APPROVED FOR THESE  PURPOSES  BY
    7  THE  STATE  COMMISSIONER  OF  HEALTH.  THE  COMMISSIONER OF HEALTH SHALL
    8  PRESCRIBE THE RULES UNDER WHICH SUCH APPROVALS SHALL BE GRANTED, INCLUD-
    9  ING THEREIN STANDARDS REGARDING THE  CARE  AND  TREATMENT  OF  ANY  SUCH
   10  ANIMALS.  SUCH RULES SHALL BE PUBLISHED AND COPIES THEREOF CONSPICUOUSLY
   11  POSTED IN EACH SUCH LABORATORY OR INSTITUTION.   THE STATE  COMMISSIONER
   12  OF  HEALTH OR HIS DULY AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVE SHALL HAVE THE POWER TO
   13  INSPECT SUCH LABORATORIES OR INSTITUTIONS TO INSURE COMPLIANCE WITH SUCH
   14  RULES AND STANDARDS. EACH SUCH APPROVAL MAY BE REVOKED AT ANY  TIME  FOR
   15  FAILURE  TO COMPLY WITH SUCH RULES AND IN ANY CASE THE APPROVAL SHALL BE
   16  LIMITED TO A PERIOD NOT EXCEEDING ONE YEAR.
   17  S 236.03 AGGRAVATED CRUELTY TO ANIMALS.
   18    1. A PERSON IS GUILTY OF AGGRAVATED CRUELTY TO ANIMALS WHEN,  WITH  NO
   19  JUSTIFIABLE  PURPOSE,  HE  OR  SHE  INTENTIONALLY KILLS OR INTENTIONALLY
   20  CAUSES SERIOUS PHYSICAL INJURY TO A  COMPANION  ANIMAL  WITH  AGGRAVATED
   21  CRUELTY.  FOR  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, "AGGRAVATED CRUELTY" SHALL MEAN
   22  CONDUCT WHICH: (I) IS INTENDED TO CAUSE EXTREME PHYSICAL PAIN;  OR  (II)
   23  IS DONE OR CARRIED OUT IN AN ESPECIALLY DEPRAVED OR SADISTIC MANNER.
   24    2. NOTHING CONTAINED IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO PROHIBIT OR
   25  INTERFERE  IN ANY WAY WITH ANYONE LAWFULLY ENGAGED IN HUNTING, TRAPPING,
   26  OR FISHING, AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLE ELEVEN OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVA-
   27  TION LAW, THE DISPATCH OF RABID OR  DISEASED  ANIMALS,  AS  PROVIDED  IN
   28  ARTICLE  TWENTY-ONE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW, OR THE DISPATCH OF ANIMALS
   29  POSING A THREAT TO HUMAN SAFETY OR OTHER ANIMALS, WHERE SUCH  ACTION  IS
   30  OTHERWISE  LEGALLY  AUTHORIZED,  OR  ANY  PROPERLY  CONDUCTED SCIENTIFIC
   31  TESTS, EXPERIMENTS,  OR  INVESTIGATIONS  INVOLVING  THE  USE  OF  LIVING
   32  ANIMALS, PERFORMED OR CONDUCTED IN LABORATORIES OR INSTITUTIONS APPROVED
   33  FOR  SUCH  PURPOSES  BY  THE  COMMISSIONER OF HEALTH PURSUANT TO SECTION
   34  236.02 OF THIS ARTICLE.
   35    3. AGGRAVATED CRUELTY TO ANIMALS IS A FELONY. A DEFENDANT CONVICTED OF
   36  THIS OFFENSE SHALL BE SENTENCED PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (B) OF SUBDIVISION
   37  ONE OF SECTION 55.10 OF THIS CHAPTER PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT ANY TERM OF
   38  IMPRISONMENT IMPOSED FOR VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE  A  DEFINITE
   39  SENTENCE, WHICH MAY NOT EXCEED TWO YEARS.
   40  S 236.04 APPROPRIATE SHELTER FOR DOGS LEFT OUTDOORS.
   41    1. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION:
   42    (A)  "PHYSICAL CONDITION" SHALL INCLUDE ANY SPECIAL MEDICAL NEEDS OF A
   43  DOG DUE TO DISEASE, ILLNESS, INJURY, AGE OR BREED ABOUT WHICH THE  OWNER
   44  OR PERSON WITH CUSTODY OR CONTROL OF THE DOG SHOULD REASONABLY BE AWARE.
   45    (B)  "INCLEMENT WEATHER" SHALL MEAN WEATHER CONDITIONS THAT ARE LIKELY
   46  TO ADVERSELY AFFECT THE HEALTH OR SAFETY OF THE DOG, INCLUDING  BUT  NOT
   47  LIMITED TO RAIN, SLEET, ICE, SNOW, WIND, OR EXTREME HEAT AND COLD.
   48    (C) "DOGS THAT ARE LEFT OUTDOORS" SHALL MEAN DOGS THAT ARE OUTDOORS IN
   49  INCLEMENT  WEATHER  WITHOUT  READY ACCESS TO, OR THE ABILITY TO ENTER, A
   50  HOUSE, APARTMENT BUILDING,  OFFICE  BUILDING,  OR  ANY  OTHER  PERMANENT
   51  STRUCTURE  THAT  COMPLIES WITH THE STANDARDS ENUMERATED IN PARAGRAPH (B)
   52  OF SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION.
   53    2. (A) ANY PERSON WHO OWNS OR HAS CUSTODY OR CONTROL OF A DOG THAT  IS
   54  LEFT  OUTDOORS  SHALL  PROVIDE IT WITH SHELTER APPROPRIATE TO ITS BREED,
   55  PHYSICAL CONDITION AND THE CLIMATE.  ANY PERSON WHO  KNOWINGLY  VIOLATES
   56  THE  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE GUILTY OF A VIOLATION, PUNISHA-

       A. 1835                             5

    1  BLE BY A FINE OF NOT LESS THAN FIFTY DOLLARS NOR MORE THAN  ONE  HUNDRED
    2  DOLLARS  FOR  A  FIRST  OFFENSE, AND A FINE OF NOT LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED
    3  DOLLARS NOR MORE THAN TWO HUNDRED FIFTY DOLLARS FOR A SECOND AND  SUBSE-
    4  QUENT OFFENSES.  BEGINNING SEVENTY-TWO HOURS AFTER A CHARGE OF VIOLATING
    5  THIS  SECTION,  EACH DAY THAT A DEFENDANT FAILS TO CORRECT THE DEFICIEN-
    6  CIES IN THE DOG SHELTER FOR A DOG THAT HE OR SHE OWNS OR THAT IS IN  HIS
    7  OR  HER  CUSTODY OR CONTROL AND THAT IS LEFT OUTDOORS, SO AS TO BRING IT
    8  INTO COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL  CONSTITUTE  A
    9  SEPARATE OFFENSE.
   10    (B)  THE  COURT  MAY, IN ITS DISCRETION, REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ANY FINE
   11  IMPOSED FOR A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION BY THE AMOUNT WHICH THE  DEFEND-
   12  ANT  PROVES  HE OR SHE HAS SPENT PROVIDING A DOG SHELTER OR REPAIRING AN
   13  EXISTING DOG SHELTER SO THAT IT COMPLIES WITH THE REQUIREMENTS  OF  THIS
   14  SECTION.  NOTHING  IN  THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL PREVENT THE SEIZURE OF A DOG
   15  FOR A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION PURSUANT TO  THE  AUTHORITY  GRANTED  IN
   16  THIS ARTICLE.
   17    3. MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR DETERMINING WHETHER SHELTER IS APPROPRIATE TO
   18  A DOG'S BREED, PHYSICAL CONDITION AND THE CLIMATE SHALL INCLUDE:
   19    (A)  FOR  DOGS  THAT  ARE  RESTRAINED IN ANY MANNER OUTDOORS, SHADE BY
   20  NATURAL OR ARTIFICIAL MEANS TO PROTECT THE DOG FROM DIRECT  SUNLIGHT  AT
   21  ALL  TIMES WHEN EXPOSURE TO SUNLIGHT IS LIKELY TO THREATEN THE HEALTH OF
   22  THE DOG.
   23    (B) FOR ALL DOGS THAT ARE LEFT OUTDOORS IN INCLEMENT WEATHER, A  HOUS-
   24  ING  FACILITY,  WHICH  MUST:  (I) HAVE A WATERPROOF ROOF; (II) BE STRUC-
   25  TURALLY SOUND WITH INSULATION APPROPRIATE TO LOCAL  CLIMATIC  CONDITIONS
   26  AND  SUFFICIENT  TO  PROTECT  THE  DOG  FROM INCLEMENT WEATHER; (III) BE
   27  CONSTRUCTED TO ALLOW EACH DOG  ADEQUATE  FREEDOM  OF  MOVEMENT  TO  MAKE
   28  NORMAL  POSTURAL  ADJUSTMENTS,  INCLUDING  THE ABILITY TO STAND UP, TURN
   29  AROUND AND LIE DOWN WITH ITS LIMBS  OUTSTRETCHED;  AND  (IV)  ALLOW  FOR
   30  EFFECTIVE  REMOVAL  OF EXCRETIONS, OTHER WASTE MATERIAL; DIRT AND TRASH.
   31  THE HOUSING FACILITY AND THE AREA IMMEDIATELY SURROUNDING  IT  SHALL  BE
   32  REGULARLY  CLEANED TO MAINTAIN A HEALTHY AND SANITARY ENVIRONMENT AND TO
   33  MINIMIZE HEALTH HAZARDS.
   34    4. INADEQUATE SHELTER MAY BE INDICATED BY THE APPEARANCE OF THE  HOUS-
   35  ING  FACILITY  ITSELF,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT LIMITED TO, SIZE, STRUCTURAL
   36  SOUNDNESS, EVIDENCE OF CROWDING WITHIN THE HOUSING  FACILITY,  HEALTHFUL
   37  ENVIRONMENT IN THE AREA IMMEDIATELY SURROUNDING SUCH FACILITY, OR BY THE
   38  APPEARANCE OR PHYSICAL CONDITION OF THE DOG.
   39    5.  UPON  A  FINDING OF ANY VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION, ANY DOG OR DOGS
   40  SEIZED PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE  THAT  HAVE  NOT  BEEN
   41  VOLUNTARILY  SURRENDERED BY THE OWNER OR CUSTODIAN OR FORFEITED PURSUANT
   42  TO COURT ORDER SHALL BE RETURNED TO THE OWNER  OR  CUSTODIAN  ONLY  UPON
   43  PROOF  THAT  APPROPRIATE  SHELTER  AS  REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION IS BEING
   44  PROVIDED.
   45    6.  NOTHING  IN  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE  CONSTRUED  TO  AFFECT   ANY
   46  PROTECTIONS AFFORDED TO DOGS OR OTHER ANIMALS UNDER ANY OTHER PROVISIONS
   47  OF THIS ARTICLE.
   48  S 236.05 ELECTROCUTION OF FUR-BEARING ANIMALS PROHIBITED.
   49    1.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, NO PERSON SHALL INTEN-
   50  TIONALLY KILL, OR STUN TO  FACILITATE  THE  KILLING  OF,  A  FUR-BEARING
   51  ANIMAL  BY  MEANS  OF  AN  ELECTRICAL  CURRENT.  FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS
   52  SECTION, "FUR-BEARING ANIMAL" MEANS ARCTIC FOX,  RED  FOX,  SILVER  FOX,
   53  CHINCHILLA,  MINK,  PINE  MARTEN, MUSKRAT, AND THOSE FUR-BEARING ANIMALS
   54  INCLUDED WITHIN THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 11-1907 OF  THE  ENVIRONMENTAL
   55  CONSERVATION LAW.

    1    2.  A VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION IS A CLASS A MISDE-
    2  MEANOR.
    3  S 236.06 SALE OF BABY CHICKS AND BABY RABBITS.
    4    1.  NO  PERSON  SHALL SELL, OFFER FOR SALE, BARTER OR GIVE AWAY LIVING
    5  BABY CHICKS, DUCKLINGS OR OTHER FOWL OR BABY RABBITS UNLESS SUCH  PERSON
    6  PROVIDES  PROPER  BROODER  FACILITIES  WHERE APPROPRIATE FOR THE CARE OF
    7  SUCH BABY CHICKS, DUCKLINGS OR OTHER FOWL OR  BABY  RABBITS  DURING  THE
    8  TIME THEY ARE IN THE POSSESSION OF SUCH PERSON. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS
    9  SECTION, A BABY RABBIT SHALL BE A RABBIT OF LESS THAN TWO MONTHS OF AGE.
   10    2. NO PERSON SHALL SELL, OFFER FOR SALE, BARTER OR DISPLAY LIVING BABY
   11  CHICKS,  DUCKLINGS  OR  OTHER FOWL OR BABY RABBITS WHICH HAVE BEEN DYED,
   12  COLORED OR OTHERWISE TREATED SO AS  TO  IMPART  TO  THEM  AN  ARTIFICIAL
   13  COLOR.
   14    2-A.  NO  PROVISION OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE INTER-
   15  PRETED OR APPLIED TO PREVENT OR RESTRICT TEACHERS AND QUALIFIED INSTRUC-
   16  TORS OF YOUTH UNDER THE GUIDANCE AND SUPERVISION OF THE NEW  YORK  STATE
   17  COOPERATIVE EXTENSION SERVICE FROM USING EGGS FOR NON-PROFIT EDUCATIONAL
   18  PURPOSES  OR  FROM  OBSERVING FOWL HATCHED FROM SUCH EGGS FOR NON-PROFIT
   19  EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
   20    3. NO PERSON SHALL SELL, OFFER FOR SALE, BARTER OR  GIVE  AWAY  LIVING
   21  BABY CHICKS, DUCKLINGS OR OTHER FOWL OR BABY RABBITS UNDER TWO MONTHS OF
   22  AGE IN ANY QUANTITY LESS THAN SIX.
   23    4.  A  VIOLATION  OF  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION IS A MISDEMEANOR,
   24  PUNISHABLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR NOT MORE THAN ONE YEAR, OR BY A  FINE  OF
   25  NOT MORE THAN FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH.
   26  S 236.07 ABANDONMENT OF ANIMALS.
   27    A  PERSON BEING THE OWNER OR POSSESSOR, OR HAVING CHARGE OR CUSTODY OF
   28  AN ANIMAL, WHO ABANDONS SUCH ANIMAL, OR LEAVES IT TO DIE  IN  A  STREET,
   29  ROAD OR PUBLIC PLACE, OR WHO ALLOWS SUCH ANIMAL, IF IT BECOMES DISABLED,
   30  TO  LIE  IN  A PUBLIC STREET, ROAD OR PUBLIC PLACE MORE THAN THREE HOURS
   31  AFTER HE RECEIVES NOTICE THAT IT IS LEFT DISABLED, IS GUILTY OF A MISDE-
   32  MEANOR, PUNISHABLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR NOT MORE THAN ONE YEAR, OR  BY  A
   33  FINE OF NOT MORE THAN ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BY BOTH.
   34  S 236.08 FAILURE  TO  PROVIDE  PROPER  FOOD  AND  DRINK  TO AN IMPOUNDED
   35             ANIMAL.
   36    A PERSON WHO, HAVING IMPOUNDED OR  CONFINED  ANY  ANIMAL,  REFUSES  OR
   37  NEGLECTS  TO  SUPPLY  TO SUCH ANIMAL DURING ITS CONFINEMENT A SUFFICIENT
   38  SUPPLY OF GOOD AND WHOLESOME AIR, FOOD, SHELTER AND WATER, IS GUILTY  OF
   39  A MISDEMEANOR, PUNISHABLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR NOT MORE THAN ONE YEAR, OR
